intro: Dortmanna cordigera, commonly known as the heartleaf moss, is a member of the family Dicranaceae. It is a small, acrocarpous moss that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rock crevices. The plant has a distinctive morphology, with elongated, cordate (heart-shaped) leaves that are often recurved at the tips. Its reproductive structures, including the capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks. Dortmanna cordigera is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appearance and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
